title: Job Title: Senior Architectural Designer & Bathroom Rendering Specialist (UK Market)
description:
HELLO, PLEASE KINDLY READ THE JOB ROLE BEFORE YOU APPLY, OR WE WILL SPAM YOUR APPLICATION. 



Employer: Property Maintenance & Bathroom Renovation Company

Location: Remote 

Hours: Full-time, Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:30 PM GMT

Salary: Starting based on experience.

Start Date: Immediate or ASAP

Type: Long-term, Full-Time





Key Requirement: No Training Provided



We are not looking for someone who is “willing to learn.” We need an expert in realistic bathroom design, rendering, and product compatibility — someone who has done this hundreds of times, ideally for Western clients. You must know how to design, render, and select products correctly without needing supervision or basic instructions.



Role Summary



This is a senior-level, full-time remote role suited to an experienced Architectural Designer who specialises in photorealistic 3D bathroom visualisation, technical design, and material compatibility.



Your primary responsibility will be to deliver professional UK-standard bathroom designs and renders independently, while understanding spatial constraints, fixture compatibility, and design practicality. You must have extensive experience producing realistic renders, selecting materials, and generating takeoffs — all with zero hand-holding.



Essential Requirements



Minimum 2 years of full-time experience with bathroom design and rendering

Extensive use of Chief Architect, SketchUp, AutoCAD or equivalent tools

Ability to produce high-end photorealistic renderings (not just basic modelling)

Full understanding of bathroom product compatibility (e.g., spacing, fixture conflicts, flow)

Experience creating and reading floor plans, elevations, and installation drawings

Capable of preparing take-offs, schedules, and presentation documents

Understanding of UK residential design principles and ability to adapt to UK standards

Strong command of English and confident written communication

Detail-oriented and able to follow technical briefs with precision

Capable of using AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT) to verify UK regulations or cross-check standards

Self-directed and accountable — no micromanagement will be provided



Primary Responsibilities



1. Bathroom Rendering & Design (Core Task)

Create photorealistic renders based on site measurements and material schedules

Apply correct lighting, texture, and finishes for realism and visual appeal

Model unique items when necessary (e.g. if item not available in library)

Improve current company rendering standards

Replicate renders from supplied concept and elevation plans



2. Space Planning & Layout Development

Read measured surveys and existing floor plans

Propose practical and beautiful bathroom layouts (to scale)

Optimise spatial flow and clearance for UK bathrooms

Identify when product selections compromise design functionality



3. Material Selection & Coordination

Create and update detailed material schedules for:

Floor & wall tiles

Sanitary ware

Shower systems, taps, accessories

Lighting and cabinetry finishes

Ensure material combinations are complementary and technically viable

Collaborate with in-house staff to refine selections before client presentation



4. Take-Offs, Drawings & Documentation

Provide clear CAD-based:

Floorplans

Elevation drawings

Installation schematics

Measurement documents

Produce accurate take-offs (tiles, cabinetry, fittings)

Assist with preparing presentation sheets for clients





Long-Term Growth Responsibilities (Optional After Initial 2 Months)

• Join project planning and estimation meetings

• Support admin staff with client quotation documentation

• Create visual guides and proposal documents

• Help with project scheduling & maintenance planning

• Update notes and logs in Google Sheets/ServiceM8

• Attend customer design meetings via Google Meet (observational role)

• Opportunity to expand into project management or estimation for right candidate

Software Tools You Must Be Proficient In

• Chief Architect (strongly preferred)

• SketchUp + rendering plugins (e.g. V-Ray or Enscape)

• AutoCAD

• Google Workspace (Drive, Sheets, Docs)

• ChatGPT (for compliance checks, research)

• ServiceM8 (training provided if needed)



Additional Notes

• This role requires active collaboration with our PH-based team (including daily WhatsApp updates)

• All assets you produce are property of TMT Central under UK and PH IP laws

• Clear naming/versioning conventions must be followed in file management

• You must participate in team chats and internal discussions to ensure alignment on client projects

• You’ll be expected to maintain high visual standards for all public-facing materials



Do Not Apply If:

• You only have kitchen design/rendering experience

• You need training on how UK bathrooms work

• You’ve never done 3D bathroom design or worked with real client projects

• You don’t understand realistic spacing between basins, WCs, showers, etc.

• You require daily supervision to stay productive



How to Apply

Please send a job-specific cover letter outlining your experience, your CV, and examples of your work.

title: Freelance Rendering Artist & Draftsperson
description:
Freelance Rendering Artist & Draftsperson (Outdoor Living)

We are seeking a detail-oriented Rendering Artist / Draftsperson to join our team on a per-project basis. In this role, you will be responsible for transforming conceptual sketches and measurements into high-quality technical drawings and photorealistic visualizations for custom outdoor structures, specifically high-end pergolas and shade systems.



Core Responsibilities

Technical Drafting: Create precise 2D shop drawings, floor plans, and elevations using AutoCAD or similar software.



3D Modeling & Visualization: Develop photorealistic 3D renderings that showcase textures (aluminum, wood, fabric), lighting, and integration with existing architectural environments.



Design Collaboration: Interpret site measurements and client briefs to ensure structures are both aesthetically pleasing and structurally feasible.



Revisions: Incorporate feedback from the design team and clients to refine models and drawings until final approval.



Required Skills & Qualifications

Software Proficiency: Expert-level skills in AutoCAD (for drafting) and 3ds Max, SketchUp, or Rhino (for modeling).



Rendering Engines: Experience with Lumion, V-Ray, or Enscape to produce high-end visuals.



Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with outdoor construction materials, motorized shade systems, and louvered roof mechanics is a significant plus.



Communication: Ability to work remotely and meet strict project deadlines.



Portfolio: A strong portfolio demonstrating previous work in architectural visualization or outdoor living spaces.



Project Workflow & Compensation

Basis: This is a per-project/contract position.



Workflow: You will be provided with site photos, dimensions, and product specifications.



Deliverables: Typically includes (1) Set of 2D technical drawings and (2) 3-4 High-resolution 3D renders.



Rate: Negotiable per project based on complexity and urgency.



How to Apply

Please submit your portfolio (PDF or link) and your standard rate sheet for a typical pergola project. We are looking for a long-term freelance partner who can grow with our project volume.

mbers.

title: Expert Property Acquisitions Associate
description:
Summary

Role Overview

The Acquisitions Associate is responsible for building and managing Parity’s property acquisition pipeline. This role owns the front end of the development funnel: identifying absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties, maintaining a clean and accurate owner database, conducting outbound outreach, and negotiating purchase terms that align with Parity’s mission and financial parameters. This is a hands-on role that blends data management, outbound communication, negotiation, and coordination with legal and development teams.



Key Responsibilities

1. Acquisition Pipeline & Database Management

• Build, maintain, and continuously clean a database of absentee owners of vacant and distressed properties.

• Aggregate and verify ownership data from public records, tax data, and third-party sources.

• Track owner status, outreach history, responsiveness, and deal stage in Parity’s CRM or database.

• Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across systems.



2. Owner Outreach & Relationship Management

• Execute outbound outreach campaigns via phone,
, and direct mail.

• Respond to inbound inquiries from property owners.

• Build rapport with owners and clearly communicate Parity’s mission, process, and timelines.

• Maintain consistent follow-up to move owners through the decision-making process.

3. Deal Evaluation & Negotiation

• Conduct preliminary deal screening based on location, condition, and feasibility.

• Negotiate purchase price and basic terms within pre-approved parameters.

• Coordinate property walk-throughs and inspections with internal teams.

• Prepare internal deal summaries and recommendations.

4. Transaction Coordination

• Work closely with legal counsel, title companies, and internal staff through contract and closing.

• Track deal milestones and ensure timely progression to settlement.

• Maintain organized records of contracts, correspondence, and transaction documents.

5. Process Improvement & Reporting

• Help refine acquisition workflows, templates, and outreach scripts.

• Track and report on key metrics such as outreach volume, response rates, conversions, and acquisitions.

• Identify bottlenecks and propose improvements to increase acquisition velocity.



Required Qualifications

• 2–5 years of experience in real estate, acquisitions, development, sales, or a related field.

• Strong organizational skills and comfort managing large datasets.

• Experience with outbound outreach (calls,
s, mail campaigns).

• Demonstrated negotiation skills and comfort having direct financial conversations.

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication.

• High attention to detail and follow-through.

• Experience with property acquisition.

• CRM and database experience (Airtable, HubSpot, etc.).

• Comfort working in a mission-driven, fast-paced environment.

$1,100 USD per month

Full-time: 40 hours per week

Equivalent to $6.88/hour

Paid Time Off (PTO)

Yearly Salary Increases & Bonus

Full Training Provided



How To Apply (IMPORTANT)



The ONLY way to apply is through this link:



=> 
/s/ahsfn66f



You must complete the assessment (takes up to 43 minutes max).



Your resume MUST be submitted through that link. Applications sent any other way will not be considered.



Why We Require This Test



We receive hundreds of applicants, and resumes alone don’t tell us who is truly smart, detail-oriented, and able to solve problems independently.



This assessment is the fastest and fairest way for us to filter applicants based on cognitive aptitude (how quickly you learn, follow instructions, and troubleshoot issues). That matters a lot in Amazon/Walmart work.



If you do well, you’ll be prioritized for a long-term, full-time role with $1,100/month pay, PTO, and full training.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



1) Amazon & Walmart Product Listings

3) Promotions, Pricing & Weekly Reporting

Compile weekly performance metrics (traffic, conversion, keyword movement)

Monitor competitor changes and flag opportunities



4) Inventory, Shipments & Issue Resolution

Create and manage FBA and Walmart WFS shipments end-to-end

Open and follow up on Seller Support cases until resolved

Fix suppressed listings, stranded inventory, and account health issues



What We’re Looking For



Strong written English (near-native)

Detail-oriented and highly organized

Experience inside Amazon Seller Central (Walmart is a plus)

Comfortable with Excel (VLOOKUP, pivots, inventory sheets)

Ability to troubleshoot issues independently after training

title: GL Accountant (For Pooling)
description:
We are building a talent pool of experienced GL Accountants for potential client requirements, supporting entities in the United States, Australia, and Singapore.



This role is for pooling purposes only. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted as soon as matching client opportunities become available.



Job Overview

The GL Accountant will be responsible for managing general ledger activities, ensuring accurate financial reporting, and maintaining compliance with applicable accounting standards (US GAAP, with possible AU / SG exposure).



Key Responsibilities

Oversee and manage the general ledger process, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with US GAAP

Lead monthly, quarterly, and annual close processes for assigned entities

Perform bank and balance sheet reconciliations, including provision accounts

Investigate and resolve discrepancies and variances

Prepare and review journal entries, including accruals, deferrals, depreciation, amortization, straight-line rent, amortization, and reclassifications

Ensure proper accounting treatment of fixed assets (capitalization, depreciation, impairment, and retirement)

Perform variance analysis and provide explanations for financial results

Manage multi-currency transactions, including foreign exchange gains and losses

Act as Point of Contact (POC) for assigned entities or subsidiaries

Communicate directly with AP, AR, auditors, and internal stakeholders

Support audit activities by preparing schedules and responding to auditor inquiries

Identify opportunities to improve and automate accounting processes

Support transition from 15-day close to 10-day close

Assist in documenting onboarding and accounting processes



Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

Strong understanding of US GAAP (required)

Minimum 3 years of relevant accounting experience

Experience with NetSuite or another large ERP system (required)

Advanced MS Excel skills

Hands-on experience with month-end close and reconciliations

Ability to multi-task, prioritize deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Team-oriented, professional, and positive attitude



Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting US, AU, or Singapore entities

Multi-entity and multi-currency accounting exposure

Audit support experience

CPA or equivalent certification



Application Instructions

To be considered for this position, please submit the following:

- Your application letter

- Unrestricted link to your updated resume/CV



Subject Line:

GLAcctPooling – YOUR FULL NAME



Only applicants who meet the required qualifications will be contacted.

You will play a key role in maintaining compliance with GAAP and ASC 606, partnering closely with auditors and cross-functional teams, and continuously improving accounting workflows.

title: GoHighLevel Expert
description:
About Us

Higher View Tax Services is not your average financial company. We’re a fast-growing, forward-thinking team that prioritizes excellence, connection, and creativity in everything we do. As we scale toward national goals, we’re looking for someone who can amplify our presence across key social media platforms and bring our brand voice to life with precision, strategy, and style.



Job Overview

We are seeking an expert-level GoHighLevel (GHL) Builder & Automation Specialist to help design, build, and optimize a robust, scalable CRM system inside GoHighLevel. You must be able to use the marketers tool.



This role is not for beginners, funnel-only builders, or snapshot-only users. We are building a structured, long-term CRM environment and require someone with a deep understanding of GoHighLevel’s advanced features, automation logic, and CRM architecture.



In this role, you will work closely with the Product Owner and CRM Architect to translate system requirements into clean, reliable, and scalable builds within GoHighLevel. Candidates must have hands-on experience using GoHighLevel’s marketer tools to customize and configure the platform.



Key Responsibilities



GoHighLevel CRM Development



Build, customize, and manage CRM systems within GoHighLevel.



Create and maintain pipelines, opportunity stages, custom fields, tags, and structured contact data.



Configure user roles, permissions, and access levels as needed.



Maintain clean organization, naming conventions, and consistency across the system.



Automation & Workflow Development

5. Build advanced workflows using triggers, conditions, and actions.

6. Implement tag-based and pipeline-based automation logic.

7. Configure time delays, branching paths, safeguards, and fail-safes.

8. Prevent automation conflicts, loops, duplicate actions, and system errors.

9. Optimize workflows for performance, reliability, and scalability.



Integrations & System Setup

10. Configure and manage integrations including calendars, forms, Stripe, and related system components.

11. Build and manage integrations using Zapier and/or webhooks when applicable.

12. Troubleshoot and resolve automation and integration issues efficiently.



Testing, Quality Control & Documentation

13. Test workflows end-to-end prior to launch.

14. Identify edge cases, logic gaps, and system risks.

15. Resolve issues thoroughly and promptly.

16. Document workflows, automations, and system logic clearly so future tea
mbers can easily understand and maintain the system.





Required Skills & Experience



Must-Have Qualifications:



Minimum of 3+ years of hands-on experience using GoHighLevel at an advanced level.



Strong understanding of workflows, automation logic, triggers, conditions, and actions.



Proven experience working with pipelines, tags, custom fields, and CRM data structures.



Demonstrated experience building full CRM systems, not just funnels or landing pages.



Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to identify and fix broken or conflicting automations.



High attention to detail with strong system-thinking and problem-solving abilities.





Nice-to-Have (Not Required):



Agency-level GoHighLevel experience.



Zapier or webhook integration experience.



Experience integrating GoHighLevel with WordPress or other external platforms.



Experience working in financial services, tax, or other highly structured industries.





This Role Is Not a Fit For:



Beginners or individuals still learning GoHighLevel.



Funnel-only or snapshot-only builders.



VAs who require step-by-step instructions for every task.



Candidates without real-world automation and CRM build experience.



Work Details



Remote position.

Must have working overlap with U.S. Eastern Time.

This is a long-term opportunity for the right candidate.

Paid hourly (rate based on experience).

title: E-commerce Bookkeeper - Leadership Role - Long Term Position
description:
## ATTENTION: Read Carefully Before Applying



We are a multi–seven-figure D2C e-commerce brand portfolio looking for a highly reliable In-House Accountant / Bookkeeper to own our financials across multiple brands and entities.



This is not a basic data-entry bookkeeping role.



This role exists to give leadership clear, accurate, and fast financial visibility so we can scale confidently.



If you care deeply about clean books, understand e-commerce finance, and take pride in accuracy and speed, keep reading.



---



## ABOUT US



We operate multiple Shopify-based e-commerce brands generating between $50K–$800K per month per brand.



We manage several companies under one portfolio and require brand-level and consolidated financial clarity at all times.



We are bringing this role in-house after challenges with outsourced bookkeepers who were too slow, too generic, or lacked true e-commerce expertise.



---



## ROLE PURPOSE (WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS)



Your role is to ensure our books are:



- Accurate

- Up to date

- E-commerce specific

- Delivered fast enough to drive decisions



Bad or late numbers slow growth.



Clean, timely financials unlock scale.



You are the financial backbone of the company.



---



## WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR



### Core Accounting & Bookkeeping



- Maintain accurate books for multiple brands and entities

- Manage both cash and accrual accounting

- Categorize all transactions correctly

- Perform monthly closes on time

- Reconcile:

    - Bank accounts

    - Credit cards

    - Payment processors (Shopify Payments, Stripe, PayPal, etc.)

- Track inventory purchases and COGS

- Understand and manage the full e-commerce cash flow cycle

- To make sure you are still reading, please include the word “Ledger” in your application title

- Produce balance sheets & cashflow reports



All of this to Ensure leadership always knows:



- True profitability

- Cash position

- Brand performance



### Systems & Process Ownership



- Set up and maintain scalable bookkeeping systems

- Improve financial workflows as the company grows

- Flag inconsistencies, risks, or issues proactively



## WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN THIS ROLE



- Books are clean, accurate, and always up to date

- Financial reports are delivered quickly and reliably

- Leadership fully trusts the numbers

- Cash flow surprises are eliminated

- Financial data supports faster, better decisions



## REQUIREMENTS (PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DON’T MEET THESE)



- Proven experience bookkeeping and strong understanding for e-commerce brands

- Experience with both cash and accrual accounting

- Experience managing multiple brands or entities

- Fluent in English

- Extremely detail-oriented and organized



## THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF



- You only have experience with local or service businesses

- You rely on generic accounting templates

- You are slow with reporting or monthly closes

- You don’t understand e-commerce cash flow

- You dislike ownership, accountability, or structure



## BONUSES OF WORKING WITH US



- Long-term, stable role in a growing company

- Direct impact on business growth and strategy

- High-trust environment

- Room for growth into senior finance roles

- Work with an ambitious, high-performance team



## HOW TO APPLY (IMPORTANT)



Please reply with answers to the following questions, an overview of yourself and your CV,
 and what’s app.



1. What motivates you in your work?

2. What about this role excites you most?

3. What experience do you have with e-commerce bookkeeping? BE DETAILED

4. How long have you been a bookkeeper for? 

5. Why do you think you’re a good fit for this role?

6. Why do you want to work with us specifically?



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Asset Manager
description:
Asset Management Manager – Self Storage, Commercial,  and Residential Portfolio (Remote | Full-Time)

________________________________________

About the Role

The Asset Manager supports the day-to-day administration, reporting, and operational needs of the company’s real estate portfolio, which includes commercial, residential, and self-storage properties all based in the U.S.

You will work closely with senior leadership to monitor property operations, analyze financial results, and ensure each asset is managed to achieve maximum value and profitability. This role combines financial analysis, operational oversight, and strong communication skills to ensure smooth portfolio management from a remote setting.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

• Oversee the day-to-day performance and reporting of assigned properties in the portfolio.

• Review monthly property financial statements, identify variances, and recommend improvements.

• Collaborate with property managers and leasing teams to boost occupancy, revenue, and tenant satisfaction.

• Track and manage lease expirations, renewals, and terminations; maintain accurate lease data and files.

• Conduct market research and competitive analysis to support strategic decision-making.

• Assist leadership in underwriting new acquisition opportunities and preparing preliminary financial models.

• Support the creation of annual budgets and forecasts for portfolio assets.

• Ensure compliance with lease terms and help resolve tenant or landlord concerns.

• Prepare monthly performance reports for senior management and investors.

• Maintain and build relationships with brokers, vendors, and other industry contacts.

• Support operational due diligence for acquisitions and dispositions.

• Organize and lead regular portfolio review meetings, following up on action items.

• Provide operational support to property managers in resolving urgent facility issues.

________________________________________

What We’re Looking For

• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Real Estate, or related field (required).

• 3+ years of experience in real estate asset management, property management, or portfolio oversight.

• Strong understanding of real estate operations, leasing, and financial performance metrics.

• Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (financial modeling, pivot tables, reporting).

• Experience with Yardi or similar property management software is a plus.

• Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken).

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities independently.

• Proactive problem-solver with strong analytical skills.

• Stable internet connection and ability to work during business hours in the central time zone.

________________________________________

Why Join Us?

• Work with a growing U.S.-based real estate investment firm with a diverse property portfolio.

• Be part of a professional, results-driven team that values initiative and ownership.

• Opportunities to learn and grow in asset management and portfolio strategy.

• 100% remote role with direct collaboration with U.S. leadership.

________________________________________

Work Schedule: Full-time, 40 hours/week, U.S. business hours
